content.description: Start on a low big jug pocket with a heel hook out right. Move up the arete using sloping pinches on the arete to where the arete comes to a point. Find sloping holds on the arete over the point and make a hard move over the point to a good ledge. From the ledge move up to a good pocket and continue up the arete to an easy but plant crowded topout.  The topout has a lot of rhododendron in the way and you can get through it very safely but you'll have to work your way through it. Your body stays either left of or on (after pulling the point) the arete for the duration of the climb.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter. The landing could be bad if not properly protected. It also may be worth scouting out the top so you know the foliage you are getting yourself into.
content.location: A continuation of the farthest left side of First Wall. This route is on the arete on the rock face that is trail opposite Moby's Mantle.

content.description:
Start standing using the obvious flake for hands and follow the flake up, avoiding the bush to an easy top out.

This is #22 on Boulder 6 of First Wall in the Brayack and Keenan Falcon guidebook.
content.location: The obvious flake to the right of Crack of Earthly Delights and to the left of the giant roof.

content.description: Climb the juggy arete that turns into a slabby arete with good sidepulls/pinches. Also known as "Flight of the Swallows".
content.protection: Top Rope OR thin/hand sized gear OR just Solo it.
content.location: The most down-hill arete on the Squirrel Soup Boulder.

content.description: Starting with hands in the upward-left slanting crack, follow the crack around the down-hill side of the boulder and down-climb when you get to the juggy arete on the Four Ton Mantis face.  OR you can connect it to Squirrel Soup 5.7 arete climb to the top for a highball, but easy finish.
content.location: Backside of the Squirrel Soup Boulder in the alcove between 3 boulders.

content.description:
Start standing and follow the left facing flake up to a horizontal on the flake and then up again to the topout.

This route is #11 on Boulder 3 in the First Wall area of the Brayack and Keenan Falcon Guidebook.
content.location: From the first boulder (has the route Question Mark on it) on your right from the main trail, continue past the split between this boulder and the next. On this next boulder look for the prominent flake system, just before another divide in the boulders (These boulders are close together so make sure you don't pass it).

content.description:
Aptly named, both due to the feature and the cryptic movement. Excellent rock and fun, puzzling moves. When it comes together, it climbs wonderfully. One of my favorite problems in the forest.

Start standing on a nice sidepull rail at the base of the Question Mark. Snake up the sneaky feature to an obvious pocket and undercling. A couple lock-offs on good, but hidden, edges culminate in an exciting move for the lip.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is perfect.
content.location: Furthest-right line on the First Wall. Look for the "?"

content.description:
Start with hands on both sides of a thin flake with a solid left foot. Use a big smeary foothold with thin, core intensive, moves up the right side of the flake and end on the obvious large horizontal. This problem joins 'Squirrel Poop'. Supposedly, it's an old "12a" if you continue straight up from the horizontal.

This route is #4 on Boulder 1 (Squirrel Soup Boulder) in the First Wall area of the Brayack and Keenan falcon guidebook.
content.protection: One pad for the large rocks under the problem and probably two more pads for the traverse and down climb.
content.location: When you first enter the Tilted tree area, this problem is on the side of the tall slab to the left (Squirrel Soup Boulder).

content.description: Stand start on a left facing flake.  Follow pockets to a ledge with a small tree, then use the big left facing sidepull to reach the lip and top out.

Do a step up move on a good sloping foot and climb the slab following good hands, topping out just left of the tree.

This route is #18 on Boulder 5 in the First Wall area of the Brayack and Keenan falcon guidebook.
content.location: Follow the line of boulders of First Wall until you pass a large divide between the boulders that you can walk up. From here continue down until you reach the left side of the face just right of the next arete. This climbs the slab just right of the arete. Around the left side of this arete will be a large overhanging detached roof boulder for reference.

content.description: Highball on super solid rock! Start on the obvious slab with your hands in the slanted horizontal crack. Make moves straight up sloper crimps and mini pockets straight up until you reach larger pockets and eventually the good top-out edge.
content.protection: Just bring all the pads. Dont want a broken leg if you fall on the last move.
content.location: As you walk down into Tilted Tree, the boulder is on the 'Squirrel Poop Boulder' on your left on the obvious large slab. While looking at Question Mark (V5) the Squirrel Soup Boulder is at your 5 o'clock.

content.description:
Stand start. Start with awkward hand positions on a high pocket and a low undercling. Get high feet and make a big move to a double pocket. Then up and right through a flake and horizontal to an easy top out.

This route is #14 on Boulder 5 in the First Wall area of the Brayack and Keenan falcon guidebook.
content.location: This boulder starts just before the Fiddle Area. Heading down the trail in front of the Question Mark boulder this is the 4th boulder on the First Wall. This Problem is the First Boulder you will come to on this wall.

content.description: Start stadind and ascend the perfect finger crack. At the top of the crack, move right to a sidepull crack and move up topping out to the right of the tree.
content.location: The obvious splitter finger crack near the middle of First Wall

content.description: Start standing and use the easy broken crack to the top out.
content.location: The obvious broken crack to the left of The Crack of Earthly Delights

content.description: Begin just right of Crack of Earthly Delights by stepping up high to the sloping ledge. From here make friction moves through decent sloping edges. Avoid the crack.
content.location: First Wall Left.  To the right of the obvious splitter finger crack: Crack of Earthly Delights

content.description: SIt Start on a crimp and to finger ledge.  Move up to a two finger pocket, then up through a crimp to ledges. Then find your way left on decent hands and invisible feet to a jug and then top out.
content.protection: 3 pads, spotter so you dont hit your noggin on the tree.
content.location: Begins just to the left of exclamation point and to the right of Exhume (V7) arete.

content.description: Stand start underneath a pair of crystal filled sloping pockets. Starting on crimps, or with a high left pocket seems equal in difficulty. Climb up to the two pockets to find another two finger pocket up and left. Topout left in order to avoid the tree. The rock is fairly sharp and the footholds are crystal smears. Once you get the foot sequence down, it feels proper V7.
content.protection: A single pad works. If you punt the top, you might bounce into the tree if you are unlucky.
content.location: When walking into the Tilted Tree Area, this is the first line on the First Wall to the right. The line starts in front of the large tree. (To the right of Question Mark V5).
